title: Gesv Batched: Lapack Errors not being detected
body_html:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/native/Gesv.cpp#L47

applyGesv should take a reference to infos, since we are modifying it and calling checkErrors on it below. Currently, any errors reported by Lapack for gesv_batched are being ignored. Same applies to the CUDA version (Gesv.cu)

Simply prefixing & to infos causes tests to fail (says something about JIT). Reverting my fix that prefixed & in #9742 so that I can merge my PR (bootcamp task to move gesv_single and gesv_single_out to ATen). gesv_single/gesv_single_out are not affected.

@SsnL @zou3519 @ezyang
cc @vishwakftw -- great catch!

Simply prefixing & to infos causes tests to fail (says something about JIT). Reverting my fix that prefixed & in #9742 so that I can merge my PR (bootcamp task to move gesv_single and gesv_single_out to ATen). gesv_single/gesv_single_out are not affected.

body:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/native/Gesv.cpp#L47

`applyGesv` should take a reference to `infos`, since we are modifying it and calling `checkErrors` on it below. Currently, any errors reported by Lapack for `gesv_batched` are being ignored. Same applies to the CUDA version (Gesv.cu)

Simply prefixing `&` to `infos` causes tests to fail (says something about JIT). Reverting my fix that prefixed `&` in #9742 so that I can merge my PR (bootcamp task to move gesv_single and gesv_single_out to ATen). `gesv_single`/`gesv_single_out` are not affected.

@SsnL @zou3519 @ezyang 
cc @vishwakftw -- great catch!
